---------------------------------------------------------------------
Publishers Weekly called Jack Higgins&#039;s previous novel, Midnight Runner, "as 
clipped and brutal, as credible and steel-hearted as Higgins&#039;s best. Swift and 
coursing with dark passion." The Associated Press concurred: "When it comes 
to thriller writers, one name stands well above the crowd?Jack Higgins."

And never have the stakes been higher than in his new novel.

In the waning days of World War II, Hitler gave his diary to a young aide for 
safekeeping. Now it&#039;s threatening to resurface, with explosive contents: the 
details of a meeting between emissaries of Hitler and Roosevelt to reach an 
armistice and turn their collective efforts against the Soviet Union. The 
American representative: someone very close to none other than the current 
president, Jake Cazalet. Powerful enemies of Cazalet will do anything to get 
their hands on that diary?and it is up to White House operative Blake Johnson 
and his colleague in British intelligence, Sean Dillon, to make sure they don&#039;t....

Filled with hairpin twists and high-tension action, with characters as dark and 
surprising as any he has created, Bad Company is Higgins working at the 
peak of his powers.

----

Since The Eagle Has Landed?one of the biggest-selling thrillers of all 
time?every novel Jack Higgins has written, including his most recent works, 
Edge of Danger and Midnight Runner, has become an international bestseller. 
Many of his books have been made into successful movies, among them The 
Eagle Has Landed, To Catch a King, On Dangerous Ground, Eye of the Storm, 
and Thunder Point.

----

An accomplished stage, film, and television actor, Patrick Macnee is probably 
best known for his performance as John Steed in the long-running hit 
television series The Avengers. He can also be heard on recordings of 
Midnight Runner, Day of Reckoning, and Edge of Danger.
